item.title: 飓风 "梅利莎 "强度骤增，牙买加岌岌可危
item.description: 风暴梅利莎在一夜之间爆发出巨大的威力，它将于周二以大飓风的姿态登陆牙买加，并在整个加勒比海地区掀起暴雨；海地、多米尼加共和国和古巴将面临致命洪水的威胁，它将于周三再次登陆古巴。【原文：Storm Melissa exploded in strength overnight as it barreled toward a Tuesday landfall on Jamaica as a major hurricane, and sends torrential rains across the Caribbean — threatening deadly floods in Haiti, the Dominican Republic and Cuba, where it will come ashore again on Wednesday.】

item.title: 北欧建筑商豪赌世界最大绿色钢铁项目
item.description: 整个北欧地区的建筑公司都在北极圈以南一个面积约为 400 个足球场的建筑工地上下了大赌注。【原文：Construction firms across the Nordic region have made a high stakes bet on a building site the size of about 400 soccer fields just south of the Arctic Circle.】

item.title: 澳大利亚在拟议立法中计划设立环境监察机构
item.description: 作为拟议改革立法的一部分，澳大利亚政府计划设立一个监管机构，以改善环境法的遵守和执行情况。【原文：The Australian government plans to establish a regulator to improve compliance and enforcement of environmental laws as part of proposed reform legislation.】

item.title: 南华早报》称香港初创公司欲发射卫星获取三维风力数据
item.description: 据《南华早报》报道，香港初创公司 Stellerus 的目标是创建一个卫星星座，成为世界上首个通过设备提供三维风力数据的供应商。【原文：Hong Kong startup Stellerus aims to create a constellation of satellites to become the world’s first provider of three-dimensional wind data provided by the devices, according to the South China Morning Post.】

item.title: 澳大利亚反对派施加压力反对净零目标
item.description: 上周末，澳大利亚保守反对党联盟内部要求放弃净零排放目标的压力加大，两位关键人物加强了对气候目标的攻击。【原文：Internal pressure within Australia’s conservative opposition coalition to drop net-zero emissions targets intensified over the weekend as two key figures stepped up their attacks on the climate goals.】

item.title: 埃克森美孚起诉加州，称新环保法侵犯言论自由
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司起诉加利福尼亚州，认为该州的两项新法律试图迫使其同意某种气候观点，从而违反了第一修正案，并且与联邦法规相冲突。【原文：ExxonMobil Corp. has sued California, arguing that two new state laws violate the First Amendment by trying to force it to agree to a certain climate viewpoint, and conflict with federal regulations.】

item.title: 梅利莎在前往牙买加途中增强为四级飓风
item.description: 飓风梅利莎在接近牙买加海岸时很可能成为排行榜上的 5 级飓风，给全岛带来夷为平地的狂风和整个加勒比海地区的灾难性洪水，目前至少已有 4 人死亡。【原文：Hurricane Melissa will likely become a chart-topping Category 5 hurricane as it nears Jamaica’s coast, bringing house-flattening winds across the island and catastrophic flooding throughout the Caribbean, where at least four people have already died.】

item.title: 关税和气候变化推高咖啡价格
item.description: 咖啡价格上涨，美国的巴西咖啡豆储备减少。关税是原因之一。另一个原因是气候变化。今天的时事通讯将为您揭示早晨咖啡的变化情况。【原文：Coffee prices are up, and Brazilian bean reserves in the US are down. Tariffs are part of the story. The other is — you guessed it — climate change. Today’s newsletter sheds light on what’s going on with your morning joe.】

item.title: 欧洲最初的气候适应性城市给我们所有人上了一课
item.description:
在阿姆斯特丹建城 750 周年之际，阿姆斯特丹继续成为气候适应方面的领导者，展示了一座城市如何在克服生存挑战的过程中茁壮成长。【原文：

On Amsterdam’s 750th anniversary, it continues to be a leader in climate adaptation — showing how a city can thrive in overcoming existential challenges.

】

item.title: 风暴梅利莎的缓慢节奏使加勒比海地区面临风险
item.description:
暴风雨的速度较慢，这意味着它可能会增加降雨量，在一些地区造成几英尺深的积水。【原文：

The slowness of the storm means it is likely to increase rainfall, dumping several feet of water in some areas.

】

item.title: EDF 争取更好的条款以挽救法国海上风电项目
item.description: 法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）正在与法国政府谈判，为诺曼底附近的一个风电项目争取更好的条件，因为不断上涨的成本可能会阻碍该项目的开发。【原文：Electricite de France SA is in talks with the French government to secure better terms for a wind project off Normandy as rising costs threaten to thwart the development.】

item.title: 内政部长伯格姆提议从阿拉斯加北坡运输天然气
item.description: 美国内政部长道格-伯格姆（Doug Burgum）提出了储存阿拉斯加北坡生产的天然气并从那里直接运输的概念，他说这一提议已经引起了未具名外国投资者的兴趣。【原文：US Secretary of the Interior Doug Burgum floated the concept of storing natural gas produced in Alaska’s North Slope and shipping it directly from there, a proposal he said has drawn interest from unnamed foreign investors.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德公司正在洽谈恢复南卡罗来纳州废弃项目的事宜
item.description: 南卡罗来纳州公用事业公司 Santee Cooper 正在与布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）谈判，以重启一个废弃已久的核电项目，因为美国电力需求的激增再次激发了人们对原子能的兴趣。【原文：South Carolina utility Santee Cooper is in talks with Brookfield Asset Management to revive a long-abandoned nuclear project as surging US demand for electricity renews interest in atomic energy.】

item.title: 梅利莎风暴接近大飓风级别，造成四人死亡
item.description: 热带风暴梅利莎的强降雨周五在加勒比海造成至少四人死亡，因为它正在加强，预计将成为一场大飓风。【原文：Intense rains from Tropical Storm Melissa killed at least four people in the Caribbean on Friday as it intensifies into what’s expected to be a major hurricane.】

item.title: 共和党总检察长敦促特朗普政府抵制气候峰会
item.description: 西弗吉尼亚州总检察长约翰-麦卡斯基（John McCuskey）和其他16个州的总检察长周四呼吁特朗普政府跳过下个月在巴西举行的COP30气候大会，认为参加此次大会将使与唐纳德-特朗普总统的议程相悖的政策合法化。【原文：West Virginia Attorney General John McCuskey and attorneys general from 16 other states on Thursday called on the Trump administration to skip next month’s COP30 climate conference in Brazil, arguing that taking part would legitimize policies at odds with President Donald Trump’s agenda.】

item.title: 大石油公司不愿削减的环保局污染者报告计划
item.description: 特朗普政府提出了一系列环境法的倒退措施，其中很多都是化石燃料行业所要求的。但有一项提议却让石油和天然气公司不那么兴奋。【原文：The Trump administration has proposed a number of rollbacks to environmental laws, many of which the fossil fuel industry has asked for. But there’s one proposal oil and gas companies are less than excited about.】

item.title: 德国风力发电量激增导致电价暴跌
item.description: 德国的风力发电量飙升至去年年初以来的最高水平，使电价跌破零点。【原文：Wind generation in Germany soared to the highest since early last year, sending power prices tumbling below zero.】

item.title: 挪威财富基金审查主权债务以防范灾害风险
item.description: 全球最大的财富基金正在审查其政府债券投资组合，以评估哪些发行人最有可能受到气温上升带来的极端天气模式的影响。【原文：The world’s biggest wealth fund is reviewing its government bond portfolio to assess which issuers are most at risk from the fallout of extreme weather patterns brought on by rising temperatures.】

item.title: Qualitas 基金出资 32.5 亿欧元瞄准可再生能源交易
item.description: 西班牙投资基金 Qualitas Energy 开始为新基金募集 32.5 亿欧元（38 亿美元）资金，押注欧洲清洁能源行业的整合浪潮。【原文：Spanish investment fund Qualitas Energy is betting on a wave of consolidation in Europe’s clean-energy sector as it starts raising €3.25 billion ($3.8 billion) for a new fund.】

item.title: 中国的大宗碳配额报价低于启动价
item.description: 中国全国碳市场交易商的报价低于市场启动时的水平，因为排放者希望在今年晚些时候取消配额之前抛售剩余配额。【原文：China’s national carbon market traders are offering prices below the level at which the market launched, as emitters look to dump surplus allowances before they are canceled later this year.】

item.title: 特朗普政府采取行动加快数据中心的电力连接
item.description: 特朗普政府正在推动监管机构大幅加快允许蓬勃发展的数据中心行业与电网连接的进程。【原文：The Trump administration is pushing regulators to drastically accelerate the process of allowing the booming data-center sector to connect to power grids.】

item.title: 特朗普计划向近海钻井开放几乎所有美国海岸线
item.description: 尽管遭到各州州长的反对，而且总统此前曾试图关闭部分地区，但特朗普政府仍准备提出一项建议，向新的海上石油钻探开放几乎所有美国沿海水域。【原文：The Trump administration is readying a proposal to open almost all US coastal waters to new offshore oil drilling despite opposition from state governors and the president’s previous efforts to close off some of the territory.】

item.title: 特朗普重新开放阿拉斯加北极沿岸平原石油钻探
item.description: 特朗普政府正在开放阿拉斯加整个北极国家野生动物保护区的石油和天然气租赁，推翻了拜登政府将这一原始荒野地区列为禁区的决定。【原文：The Trump administration is opening Alaska’s entire Arctic National Wildlife Refuge to oil and gas leasing, reversing a Biden administration decision that put the pristine wilderness area off limits.】

item.title: 热冲击使佛罗里达珊瑚濒临灭绝
item.description:
极端的海洋温度导致珊瑚物种灭绝，而珊瑚礁是保护该州城市免受气候风暴影响的关键。【原文：

Extreme ocean temperatures triggered the demise of coral species key to the health of a reef that protects the state’s cities from climate-driven storms.

】

item.title: 欧盟领导人达成停战协议，为实现宏伟的气候目标铺平道路
item.description: 欧盟领导人同意在绿色转型期间支持关键产业并削减繁文缛节，从而为达成雄心勃勃的新气候目标铺平了道路。【原文：European Union leaders paved the way for a deal on ambitious new climate targets by agreeing to support key industries and cut red tape during the green transition.】

item.title: 灾难工业综合体正在推动美国经济增长
item.description: 有些故事的开头平淡无奇，而有些故事则如闪电般袭来。只有偶尔两者兼而有之。 在今天的时事通讯中，我们将分享我们关于灾难工业综合体的新专题背后的故事，以及在飓风海伦之后，灾难工业综合体如何在北卡罗来纳州西部上演。【原文：Some stories have mundane beginnings, while others strike like lightning. Only occasionally is it both. In today’s newsletter, we share the story behind our new feature on the disaster industrial complex, and how it’s playing out in western North Carolina in the wake of Hurricane Helene.】

item.title: 大型石油公司为何要求环保局不要削减污染者报告计划
item.description:
石油和天然气行业表示，他们需要该计划的数据来开展业务。【原文：

The oil and gas industry says it needs the program’s data to conduct business. 

】

item.title: 期待咖啡价格不断创新高。这就是为什么
item.description:
最近几个月，美国对巴西征收的关税抬高了咖啡豆的价格，但从长远来看，气候变化将使咖啡豆价格居高不下。【原文：

US tariffs on Brazil have raised coffee bean prices in recent months, but climate change will keep them high over the long run. 

】

item.title: 暴风雨袭击欧洲，停电和旅行中断情况加剧
item.description: 一场造成飓风、暴雨和波涛汹涌的风暴正在侵袭欧洲，导致停电和旅行中断。【原文：A storm causing hurricane-force winds, heavy rain and choppy seas is pummeling Europe, leading to power outages and travel disruptions.】

item.title: 北约呼吁投资清洁燃料以减少对俄罗斯的依赖
item.description:
一群退伍军人和国防专家敦促欧洲领导人在布鲁塞尔峰会之前加大对绿色燃料的支持力度。【原文：

A group of military veterans and defense experts urged European leaders to boost support for green fuels ahead of their summit in Brussels.

】
